working_definition: Multiple Disabilities means concomitant impairments (such as intellectual disability-blindness or intellectual disability-orthopedic impairment), the combination of which causes such severe educational needs that they cannot be accommodated in a special education program solely for one of the impairments.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Intellectual Disability and Orthopedic Impairment
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: Combination that affects both learning and physical access, requiring support in academics and mobility.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Deaf-Blindness (as a type of multiple disability)
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: Severe auditory and visual impairments requiring unique methods of communication and instruction.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Cognitive and Behavioral Disabilities
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: Combination of learning difficulties and significant behavioral challenges requiring integrated interventions.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Neurological and Physical Disabilities
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: Such as cerebral palsy with intellectual challenges, requiring assistance with mobility and learning.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Autism with Sensory and Motor Impairments
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: Students with autism spectrum disorder and additional physical or sensory needs.

common_presentations: Requires assistance with mobility or physical access to learning materials
Needs individualized instruction across multiple domains
Struggles with both academic and functional skills
May use assistive technology for learning or communication
Limited endurance or stamina for daily school routines
Inconsistent response to traditional teaching methods
Needs adult support for personal care tasks
Displays behaviors that interfere with learning
Requires coordination of services from multiple specialists

accommodations_modifications.name: Use of assistive technology for communication
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Supports students with limited verbal expression
accommodations_modifications.example: Student uses a voice output device to answer questions

accommodations_modifications.name: Physical therapy and mobility support
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Improves access to classroom and school environment
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Requires assistance with mobility or physical access to learning materials
accommodations_modifications.example: Student uses a walker and receives weekly physical therapy

accommodations_modifications.name: Integrated related service scheduling
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Ensures services from therapists are coordinated with academic instruction
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Requires coordination of services from multiple specialists
accommodations_modifications.example: Speech, OT, and PT sessions are scheduled without disrupting core classes

accommodations_modifications.name: Break tasks into multi-step, structured routines
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Improves task completion and reduces frustration
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Needs individualized instruction across multiple domains
accommodations_modifications.example: Student completes writing task through guided steps over multiple days

accommodations_modifications.name: Use of sensory supports and calming tools
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Reduces behaviors triggered by sensory overload
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Displays behaviors that interfere with learning
accommodations_modifications.example: Student uses noise-canceling headphones during group activities

accommodations_modifications.name: Frequent breaks and health accommodations
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Limited endurance or stamina for daily school routines
accommodations_modifications.example: Student takes 5-minute breaks every 20 minutes to rest

accommodations_modifications.name: Functional skill instruction integrated with academics
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Teaches daily living skills in the context of academics
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Struggles with both academic and functional skills
accommodations_modifications.example: Student practices counting while setting up lunch trays

accommodations_modifications.name: Visual and tactile learning materials
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Supports learning when traditional materials are not accessible
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Inconsistent response to traditional teaching methods
accommodations_modifications.example: Student uses raised-line drawing boards and tactile books

accommodations_modifications.name: Support from paraprofessionals for daily routines
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Assists with transitions, toileting, and safety needs
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Needs adult support for personal care tasks
accommodations_modifications.example: Paraprofessional assists with lunchtime feeding and bathroom needs

accommodations_modifications.name: Collaborative team planning for IEP goals
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Aligns instructional strategies across settings and providers
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Requires coordination of services from multiple specialists
accommodations_modifications.example: Special ed teacher, OT, and SLP develop shared communication goals
